text: Franz Golobic (born 7 April 1922 in Vienna; † 20 July 2010) was an Austrian football player. He played as midfielder mainly for SK Rapid Wien. He also played three matches for the Austrian national football team. ==Career == Golobic started his senior career with FC Wien. After the end of the Second World War he played till 1946 for this club. In 1946 he went to SK Rapid Wien. During his time with the club, he played 249 league games in which he scored nine goals. ==International == 1953 Golobic played three international matches for the national team. He made his debut as a national player on 11 October 1953 Transfermarkt.at players profile in the Vienna Prater Stadium in the 2-3 defeat in a friendly against the Hungarian national team. He played his last two international matches in World Cup qualifying group 5 against the Portuguese national team. ==Honours == *Austrian championː1948, 1951, 1952, 1954, 1956, 1957 ==References == Category:1922 births Category:2010 deaths Category:Austrian footballers Category:Sportspeople from Vienna Category:Players of the Austrian national football team Category:SK Rapid Wien players Category:Austrian football champions
title: Franz Golobic
